meanings.definition: The act of flowing back or receding.
meanings.sent1: The refluences of the river created a calming rhythm in the valley.
meanings.sent2: I observed the refluences of the tide as it pulled away from the shore.
meanings.sent3: The refluences of the music made everyone sway gently to the beat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a refluences effect, spreading joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The refluences of the waterfall echoed through the canyon, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The influence exerted by something that is receding or diminishing.
meanings.sent1: The refluences of the fading sunlight painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent2: He felt the refluences of his popularity waning as new trends emerged.
meanings.sent3: The refluences of the vanishing cake tempted the children to sneak a bite.
meanings.sent4: The refluences of her departing train lingered in his heart long after she left.
meanings.sent5: The refluences of the setting sun cast long shadows across the field, signaling the end of the day.
